intro: Trichopilia laxa var. flaveola, commonly known as the yellow trichopilia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its compact, mat-forming growth habit. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in dense clusters, which bloom in late summer. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats.
